Title: TC1039 - Highways Maintenance Defect Repairs
Description:
The works will be predominantly Small Patching works to permanently repair the highway defect backlog, the contract also includes the other types of Highway Maintenance works that the Authority are legally bound to maintain, these include the following :
Traffic Management, Site Clearance, Temporary Fencing, Street Furniture, Safety Barriers, Highway Drainage, Service Covers,
All Minor Highway repairs (Bituminous and Modular) including Thermal method, Road Markings, Emergency Response including out of hours.

Title: TC103 Winter Gritting Services
Description: The Contract is intended to enable the provision of the winter services including the spreading of rock salt and liquid de-icer, and the clearing snow from public highways for which the Council is the Highway Authority, plus other areas.  The work will involve pre-treatment gritting and de-icing to prevent ice from forming on highway surfaces; post-treatment following the formation of ice and the clearance of snow plus other associated works, either on a predetermined basis along standard routes or on a reactive basis.

Title: TC975 Drainage Improvement/Repair Works
Description: Manchester City Council are looking to appoint 4 contractors to a Framework to  provide a reactive/maintenance/improvement drainage service to the highway network, which includes but is not exclusive to replacing defective gullies, excavating and repairing collapsed pipework, removing tree root infestation, de-silting, CCTV Surveys, concrete pipe lining and all other drainage related matters within the Manchester area.

Title: Building Maintenance & Cleansing Service Contract
Description:
The Council requires a Contractor to provide building maintenance and cleaning services for its property assetswhich includes corporate buildings, industrial units, schools, public buildings, public conveniences, car parks,small holdings, land and open spaces and other assets together with associated infrastructure, fixed plant andequipment. The services include:
Building Maintenance:
• Programmed maintenance
• Reactive repairs and maintenance (routine, urgent and emergency faults)
• Statutory testing and inspections
• Planning, design and construction of minor works to an estimated value of £250,000.00
• Asset and property management - record keeping
• Fire safety systems testing
• Security services (opening and locking of buildings)
• Snow and ice clearance of access routes to the Affected Property Cleaning:
• Internal Cleaning (including external entrance areas)
• Window Cleaning (inside and outside);
• Litter Picking (including Car Parks and the grounds of Corporate Buildings;
• Clinical Waste collection and disposal
• Sharp collection and disposal
• Kitchen equipment (tea points and kitchenettes)
• Pest Control
• Legionella sampling
• Consumable supplies
The estimated annual value of the contract is between £7m and £12m

Title: Contract For Provision Of Noticing Infringement And Fixed Penalty Notice Support
Description: Dorset County Council is seeking a single provider for the provision of Noticing Infringement and Fixed Penalty Noticing (FPN) Support in accordance with the Dorset Fixed Penalty Notice Scheme. The main focus of his scheme is to ensure the data on the Street Works Register (SWR) provided by works promoters is of sufficiently good quality to enable the County Council to fulfil its duty under the Traffic Management Act 2004 (TMA) to coordinate all works and events on the highway. The scheme and this contract will cover the administrative area of Dorset County Council including the Boroughs of Christchurch and Weymouth and Portland.

Title: Contract for the Provision of NRSWA Inspection and Consultancy Services
Description:
Dorset County Council is seeking a single provider for the provision of inspection and consultancy services in relation to the requirements of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991. The provider will supply an appropriate number of fully qualified
inspectors, supported by a manager, to undertake the inspections in accordance with the Code of Practice to cover the administrative area of Dorset County Council including the Boroughs of Christchurch and Weymouth and Portland.

Title: Framework Agreement for Street Lighting Assistance and Independent Connection Provision
Description:
Durham County Council is seeking to appoint a framework of suppliers to provide the above services to Durham County Council and NEPO Members and Associate Members. There are three contract LOTS available and suppliers can make submissions for individual, multiple, or all lots:
• Lot 1 - Installation works, including highway electrical connections on DNO/ IDNO (Contestable Works) and privately owned networks
• Lot 2 - Highway electrical connections on DNO/ IDNO networks including NERS project management
• Lot 3 - Highway electrical connections on DNO/ IDNO networks excluding NERS project management

Title: Walking and Cycling Network Rangers
Description:
Herefordshire Council has received an Access Fund grant from the Department for Transport to support a new Walking and Cycling Network Rangers scheme operating on Hereford City cycle paths.
Following a successful 12 week pilot, from September - December 2017, Herefordshire Council is looking for an organisation to deliver this service for a 2 year period. The aim of the service is to improve the pedestrian and cyclist experience on our traffic-free Hereford City network. This will involve keeping paths clear of vegetation and litter, cleaning signs and bins, signposting path users to relevant Council initiatives and reporting issues beyond the remit of this service to Herefordshire Council's Public Realm partner Balfour Beatty Living Places (BBLP).
There is a budget of up to £55,000 available for the delivery of this programme up until 31st March 2020.

Title: Highways Maintenance Contract 2016
Description: The Procurement exercise was to source a single supplier to satisfy Warwickshire County Council’s (theEmployer) requirements for Highways Maintenance and Improvement provisions. This was a joint procurementincluding the Employer, Coventry City Council and Solihull Metropolitan Borough Council.  The awarded Highways Maintenance Contract will start on the 5th May 2016 and have an initial Seven (7) yearterm. Following the initial term the option will be available to repeatedly extend the contract to a maximum of 36months (3 years).
